pr_title: New method for getting sponsored members and their sponsors

timeline.message:
New method for getting sponsored members and their sponsors

* We want to create a new method, which returns sponsored members and their sponsors for specific VO.
* The method returns list of sponsored members and for each of them list of rich users, who sponsor this sponsored member.
* The returned object also have to be filtered - the method returns to the sponsor only members, who are sponsored by this sponsor.

New method for getting sponsored members and their sponsors

* The returned object also have to be filtered - the method returns to the sponsor only members, who are sponsored by this sponsor.

* The returned object also have to be filtered - the method returns to the sponsor only members, who are sponsored by this sponsor.

timeline.body: We already have this method in the ``UsersManagerBl``. Please use it instead of the new implementation in MembersManagerBl.
timeline.bodyText: We already have this method in the UsersManagerBl. Please use it instead of the new implementation in MembersManagerBl.
timeline.bodyHTML: We already have this method in the UsersManagerBl. Please use it instead of the new implementation in MembersManagerBl.
timeline.author: zlamalp
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -895,6 +896,15 @@
 	 */
 	List<RichMember> convertMembersToRichMembers(PerunSession sess, List<Member> members);
 
+	/**
+	 * Converts users to rich users.
+	 *
+	 * @param sess
+	 * @param users
+	 * @return
+	 */
+	List<RichUser> convertUsersToRichUsers(PerunSession sess, List<User> users);

replies.bodyText: I deleted my new method and I used this method from UserManagerBl
replies.author: HejdaJakub

timeline.bodyHTML:
How about simplifying it

for (Member sponsoredMember : sponsoredMembers) {
	sponsoredMembersAndTheirSponsors.put(sponsoredMember, getPerunBl().getUsersManagerBl().convertUsersToRichUsers(sess, getPerunBl().getUsersManagerBl().getSponsors(sess, sponsoredMember)));
}
timeline.author: zlamalp

replies.bodyText: We decided to implemet it only in entry layer, so I changed it little bit more. I also simplified it by using stream.
replies.author: HejdaJakub

timeline.body: We do not usually specify ``PrivilegeException`` in the RPC docs, since its added automatically by the docs parsing tool.

timeline.body: You should also filter only allowed attributes based on the caller authorization, see ``membersManagerBl.filterOnlyAllowedAttributes(sess, richMembers, null, true);``

timeline.message:
New method for getting sponsored members and their sponsors

* We want to create a new method, which returns sponsored members and their sponsors for specific VO.
* The method returns list of sponsored members (RichMembers) and for each of them list of users, who sponsor this sponsored member.
* The returned object also have to be filtered - the method returns to the sponsor only members, who are sponsored by this sponsor.

New method for getting sponsored members and their sponsors

* We want to create a new method, which returns sponsored members and their sponsors for specific VO.
* The method returns list of sponsored members (RichMembers) and for each of them list of users, who sponsor this sponsored member.
* The returned object also have to be filtered - the method returns to the sponsor only members, who are sponsored by this sponsor.

timeline.body:
Is there any reason why do you call this version of the method instead of this one?
```suggestion
		richMembers = membersManagerBl.filterOnlyAllowedAttributes(sess, richMembers);
```
timeline.bodyHTML:
Is there any reason why do you call this version of the method instead of this one?

Suggested change
richMembers = membersManagerBl.filterOnlyAllowedAttributes(sess, richMembers, null, true);
richMembers = membersManagerBl.filterOnlyAllowedAttributes(sess, richMembers);
timeline.author: Vojtech-Sassmann

replies.bodyText: @zlamalp why did you suggested this version of the method?
replies.author: Vojtech-Sassmann

replies.bodyText: Well, there is no reason to resolve attribute authorization for each RichMember, if you can be sure, they are from the same VO and with the same set of attributes. Hence you can use "context=true" and authorization is resolved only once and results are reused for the next member.
replies.author: zlamalp

replies.bodyText: Ok, I was just confused because of the group parameter.
replies.author: Vojtech-Sassmann
